channel.title: Viewing Partitions?
channel.description: Hello, I have recently reinstalled ubuntu into an XP dual boot. I would like to view my ext3 partition in windows and my ntfs partition in ubuntu. Originally, I could see the NTFS one in ubuntu, but I couldn't write to it. I downloaded NTFS-config, which then gave me a message to either force mount the drive or boot into windows twice. I picked the second option, and now the partition does not even show up [it works though, as I am using Windows right now]. Any help would be appreciated. Thanks, Justis

item.title: Viewing Partitions?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Okay, thank you very much

item.title: Viewing Partitions?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ntfs-3g is the driver you want to use in linux to use ntfs partitions

http://www.google.com/search?q=ext3+windows (first result)

Read full topic
